question.title: Getting HijrahDate month name in Android
question.body:
I am trying to display formatted Islamic month name using Java, currently I have the following code:

HijrahDate date = HijrahDate.from(LocalDate.of(2024, 4, 11));
System.out.println(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM", Locale.US).format(date));

When I run this code on a Windows computer with Java 11 (Temurin jdk-11.0.8.10-hotspot), I get the following result (which I assume is a correct one):

Shawwal

See that code run at Ideone.com using Java 12, giving same result.

However when I run the same code on an Android device, I get the following output (just a month number):

10

I tested it on various devices, for example Samsung Galaxy smartphone with Android 14, emulator with Android 13 and Rockchip RK3588 box with Android 12, but all of them give the same result, so I assume it is not just a one-device or one-manufacturer problem.

Is there a reliable way to get Islamic / Hijrah calendar month names on Android?
